metadata.case_name: E.P. Royappa v. State of Tamil Nadu

facts.text: Petitioner is a member of the Indian Administrative Service in the cadre of the State of Tamil Nadu.
On 2 August 1968, petitioner was confirmed in the Selection Grade of IAS with effect from 22 May 1961. There were 8 Selection Grade posts; petitioner was No. 4 in the list.
Petitioner posted to act as Fifth Member, Board of Revenue in 1964; Fourth Member in 1965; Third Member in 1966; Second Member on 5 April 1969.

On 11 July 1969, post of Additional Chief Secretary temporarily created for one year in grade of Chief Secretary. Posts of Chief Secretary, Additional Chief Secretary, and First Member Board of Revenue deemed same category and interchangeable.
Petitioner posted to act as Additional Chief Secretary on 11 July 1969.

State wrote to Central Govt on 7 August 1969 to amend Schedule III-A IAS Pay Rules 1954. Central Govt on 26 September 1969 refused for Additional Chief Secretary, stating status of Chief Secretary unquestioned; approved pay for First Member Board of Revenue as Chief Secretary.
On 13 November 1969, petitioner posted to act as Chief Secretary vice C.A. Ramakrishnan on refused leave from 14 November 1969.
Ramakrishnan, ICS, completed 35 years service on 14 November 1969; granted refused leave for 4 months till 14 March 1970.
Petitioner signed note on 16 November 1970 stating Chief Secretary post substantively vacant from 14 March 1970; no confirmation order passed.
On 7 April 1971, petitioner appointed Deputy Chairman State Planning Commission (temporary for one year in Chief Secretary grade); did not join.
Petitioner on leave from 13 April 1971 to 5 June 1972. Raja Ram (First Member Board of Revenue) given additional charge of Deputy Chairman from 13 August 1971.
On 6 June 1972, petitioner reposted as Deputy Chairman on Rs. 3500/month; did not join, as post expired after one year.
Order dated 27 June 1972 created temporary post of Officer on Special Duty (OSD) in Chief Secretary grade for one year; petitioner transferred to it; did not join.
Petition filed in July 1972 seeking mandamus to withdraw 27 June 1972 order and repost as Chief Secretary.
Chief Minister's note and draft order on 13 November 1969 stated petitioner promoted as Chief Secretary; Gazette notification said 'to act as'.
11 senior IAS/ICS officers; petitioner No.10; selected over others due to merit.
Under FR 56(f), Ramakrishnan retired after 35 years; refused leave under FR 86(c) does not extend service or lien.
Court holds Ramakrishnan retained lien till 14 March 1970; petitioner acted temporarily.

Various allegations of mala fides: Tanjavur Coop Federation, Mudaliar effluents, Vaithialingam seniority, land acquisition Manali, Anna Samadhi, Veeranam tender, Cooum River, mid-term poll law and order.
State Planning Commission contemplated since 1970; created April 1971.
OSD post for rationalising sales tax structure, created after study of commercial taxes issues.

legal_issues.text: Whether petitioner was substantively appointed as Chief Secretary or only to act temporarily.
Whether posts of Deputy Chairman State Planning Commission and Officer on Special Duty are cadre posts under Rule 4 IAS Cadre Rules 1954 or equivalent under Rule 9 IAS Pay Rules 1954.
Whether transfer to these posts without declaration under Rule 9 is invalid.
Whether transfer amounts to hostile discrimination violating Articles 14 and 16.
Whether creation of posts and transfer of petitioner is mala fide.

petitioner_arguments.text: Posts of Deputy Chairman and OSD not validly created; not cadre posts under Rule 4 IAS Cadre Rules; no declaration of equivalence under Rule 9 IAS Pay Rules.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 4 IAS Cadre Rules 1954; Rule 9 IAS Pay Rules 1954

petitioner_arguments.text: Petitioner substantively appointed Chief Secretary per draft order and Chief Minister note; Ramakrishnan on refused leave lost lien.
Posts inferior in status; upgrading/downgrading based on occupant; hostile discrimination.
Transfers mala fide due to petitioner's fearless duty discharge against Chief Minister's associates and during elections.

respondent_arguments.text: Petitioner not substantively appointed; only acted during Ramakrishnan's refused leave; retained lien till 14 March 1970.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: FR 56(f), 86(c), 13(d); pre-Constitution rules; Madras FR note

respondent_arguments.text: Posts not cadre posts but equivalent in status/responsibility to Chief Secretary; carry same pay; created for administrative exigencies.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 9(1),(4) IAS Pay Rules 1954; proviso to Rule 4(2) IAS Cadre Rules

respondent_arguments.text: No declaration needed if equivalence clear from facts; no reduction in rank/pay.
No mala fides; all allegations belied by records; petitioner not confirmed; transfers valid.

court_reasoning.text: Gazette notification prevails; petitioner temporarily acted as Chief Secretary; no substantive vacancy till Ramakrishnan's leave expired; refused leave does not extend service but retains lien.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Petitioner signed note acknowledging no substantive appointment.

court_reasoning.text: State cannot alter cadre strength/composition; proviso to Rule 4(2) allows temporary addition of like posts but not increasing cadre; Deputy Chairman/OSD not cadre posts.
Posts equivalent in status/responsibility to Chief Secretary: Planning Commission high-powered, OSD for critical revenue reform; same pay; declaration desirable but substance matters.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Equal pay prima facie indicates equality; duties high calibre.

court_reasoning.text: No discrimination; transfers between equal posts for exigencies; no right to particular post.
court_reasoning.key_observation: IAS officers steel frame; postings as per needs.

court_reasoning.text: All mala fide allegations baseless, contradicted by affidavits/records; no contemporaneous protest; afterthought.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Petitioner accepted advice in most cases; law/order normal.

holdings.text: Petitioner not substantively appointed Chief Secretary; only temporary officiating.
Deputy Chairman and OSD posts outside cadre but equivalent in status/responsibility; transfer valid without formal declaration if substance equivalent.
No violation of Articles 14/16; no mala fides.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Writ under 32; discrimination under 14/16; ICS lien under 314

statutes_cited.name: Indian Administrative Service (Cadre) Rules, 1954
statutes_cited.relevance: Cadre strength/composition; temporary addition of like posts

statutes_cited.name: Indian Administrative Service (Pay) Rules, 1954
statutes_cited.relevance: Appointment to non-scheduled posts requires equivalence declaration

outcome.summary: Writ petition dismissed; no mandamus to withdraw transfer order or repost as Chief Secretary; contentions fail; each party bears own costs.
outcome.costs: Each party to pay and bear its own costs

key_quotes.text: The gazette notification prevails over the draft order.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Determines nature of appointment as temporary

key_quotes.text: Members of the Service should keep themselves isolated from turmoils of political parties.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: The posts of Deputy Chairman, Planning Commission and Officer on Special Duty are equal in status and responsibility.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: The petitioners allegations imputing malafides against the Chief Minister are baseless.
key_quotes.speaker: court
